alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 20 at 7:34PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Chama Above Abiquiu affecting Rio Arriba County. Rio Grande Near San Ildefonso Pueblo affecting Los Alamos and Santa Fe Counties. Rio Grande At Rio Grande at Embudo affecting Los Alamos, Rio Arriba and Santa Fe Counties. Embudo Creek Below Dixon affecting Rio Arriba County. .Warm temperatures have melted snowpack and increased river flows. ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues. * WHERE...Embudo Creek below Dixon. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 8.0 feet, Minor overbank flows are occurring above the Embudo gaging site. Access to riverside picnic facilities above Pilar and below the Taos Junction Bridge along state route 570 will be limited if further rises occur. Other localized effects due to the high water levels will begin to be felt at a stage of 10 feet but no significant flooding is expected until the river rises to 12 feet. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 6:45 PM MDT Saturday the stage was 11.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.1 feet tomorrow morning. - Action stage is 12.0 feet. - Flood stage is 13.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: To report flooding, contact your local law enforcement agency and your National Weather Service office when you can do so safely. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Sunday morning around 1000 AM MDT.
